com.atakmap.android.hierarchy

Interface HierarchyListItem

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    HierarchyListItem2
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractChildlessListItem, AbstractHierarchyListItem, AbstractHierarchyListItem2, AtmosphereToggle, AttachmentMapOverlay.AttachmentListItem, AttachmentMapOverlay.AttachmentOverlayListModel, CollisionOptions, Contact, ContourLinesOverlay, FeatureDataStoreHierarchyListItem, FeatureDataStoreMapOverlay.ListItem, FeatureHierarchyListItem, FeatureSetHierarchyListItem, FileDatabaseMapGroupHierarchyListItem, FilterMapOverlay.ListModelImpl, GalleryFileItem, GeoFenceListModel, GRGMapOverlay.GRGMapOverlayListItem, GRGMapOverlay.GRGMapOverlayListModel, GroupContact, HashtagContentListItem, HashtagListItem, HashtagMapOverlay.ListModel, HeatMapOverlay, HierarchyListAdapter.ListModelImpl, HierarchyListAdapter.SearchResults, IlluminationListItem, ImageryTransparencyListItem, ImportManagerMapOverlay.RemoteResourcesOverlayListModel, IndividualContact, LayerHierarchyListItem, LegacyAltitudeRenderingListItem, LollipopListItem, MapGroupHierarchyListItem, MapItemHierarchyListItem, MapOverlayParent.ListModelImpl, MissionPackageHierarchyListItem, ModelFileHierarchyListItem, ModelInfoHierarchyListItem, ModelsHierarchyListItem, MvtFileListItem, NonExportableMapGroupHierarchyListItem, NonExportableMapItemHierarchyListItem, RasterLayerHierarchyListItem, RasterLayerSelectionHierarchyListItem, RemoteResourceListItem, RoleGroup, RouteListModel, ServerGroupHierarchyListItem, SheetGroupListItem, TadilJContact, TakServerHierarchyListItem, TeamGroup, VideoBrowserMapOverlay.ListModel, ViewShedLayer2

    public interface HierarchyListItem
    Hierarchial list model inspired by javax.swing.tree.TreeNode.

        Returns the child node at the specified index. Behavior is undefined if the index is invalid.

      • getIconUri

        java.lang.String getIconUri()
        Returns the URI for the icon for the node.
        Returns:
        The URI for the icon for the node, null if the node has no icon, or "gone" to remove the icon space entirely.

      • getIconColor

        int getIconColor()
        Returns the color to be applied to the icon.
        Returns:
        The color to be applied to the icon, return 0xFFFFFFFF (-1) to use the original color.

      • setLocalData

        java.lang.Object setLocalData(java.lang.String s,
                              java.lang.Object o)
        Sets the specified local data on the object. Local data is user specific data that the external object displaying the list can use for its own purposes (e.g. associate some runtime computed property with a node).
        Parameters:
        s - The key for the data
        o - The value for the data
        Returns:
        The previously assigned value for the specified key.

      • getLocalData

        java.lang.Object getLocalData(java.lang.String s)
        Returns the local data associated with the node for the specified key. Local data is user specific data that the external object displaying the list can use for its own purposes (e.g. associate some runtime computed property with a node).
        Parameters:
        s - The key for the local data
        Returns:
        The local data associated with the specified key

      • getLocalData

        <T> T getLocalData(java.lang.String s,
                   java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Returns the local data associated with the node for the specified key. Local data is user specific data that the external object displaying the list can use for its own purposes (e.g. associate some runtime computed property with a node).
        Parameters:
        s - The key for the local data
        clazz - The return type for the data
        Returns:
        The local data associated with the specified key, cast to an object of template class T.

      • getAction

        <T extends Action> T getAction(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
        Returns an instance of the specified action that can be used to interact with the node's underlying content.
        Parameters:
        clazz - The action class
        Returns:
        An object that can effect the specified action or null if the specified action is not supported for the node.

      • getUserObject

        java.lang.Object getUserObject()
        Returns the user object associated with the node. This is the underlying object that the node represents; the actual returned value is implementation dependent.
        Returns:
        The user object associated with the node. May be null.

      • getExtraView

        android.view.View getExtraView()
        Returns the extra view, if any, associated with the node. The extra view occupies the space to the right of the line item and can be defined as the developer sees fit. Clicks should be passed through so you can include simple stuff like text, or more interactive things like buttons or check boxes. Should occupy space nicely with range and bearing values if any are present. If no extra view is associated with the node, the space will be empty.
        Returns:
        The extra view associated with this node, or null if there is no view.

      • refresh

        HierarchyListItem.Sort refresh(HierarchyListItem.Sort sortHint)
        Refreshes this node's descendants on the specified sort. If the specified sort cannot be supported, the current sort remains unchanged.
        Parameters:
        sortHint - The new sort
        Returns:
        The sort that is actually being used.
